itemDescription: Primate of the Southern Cone and Bishop of Chile (and Bolivia and Peru); British Anglican missionary bishop

wikipedia_page.main: Colin Frederick Bazley (born 27 June 1935) is a retired bishop in the Church of England. He was a bishop in Chile from 1969 until his retirement in 2000.

response: *2000–present: Colin Bazley, retired Bishop of Chile, lives in Higher Bebington
**1969–1977: Colin Bazley, assistant bishop for Cautin & Malleco (until 1975), then for the Santiago region
* 1977–2000: Colin Bazley, Bishop of Chile, Bolivia, and Peru (until October 1977), of Chile and Bolivia (until October 1981), and of Chile alone

As a constituent diocese of the South American province, the Anglican Church in Chile was previously led by Bishop David Pytches (1972–1976) and Bishop Colin Bazley (1977–2000). Tito Zavala became the first Chilean native bishop in 2000; Abelino Manuel Apeleo became an assistant bishop in 2016.

Enrique Lago Zugadi is a Chilean Anglican bishop:ACNS since 2018 he has been Bishop of ConcepciónSt Paul's Church, Chile in the 40th and newest Province, Chile. Lago is the son-in-law of the last English-born Bishop of Chile, Colin Bazley.
